result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome Artrell Kirkwood

records.addlTxt:
11:30 AM Defendant Jerome Artrell Kirkwood appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jerome Artrell Kirkwood.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal received information in 22CF351 and 22CF397, waives reading and pleads not guilty in each file. Court accepts not guilty pleas. Attorney Rosenthal asks for a status in mid December and would like to address bond. State in agreement to proceed. Attorney Rosenthal asks for modification to $500 cash bail in 22CF397 and makes argument to modification. State is opposed to modification of cash bail. State reviews pending charges in MN right now. Defendant also has criminal history out of IL, OH and MS. Court finds $1,000 bail appropriate and denies motion for bail modification.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of firearms. No use or possession of alcohol

9:13 AM Defendant Jerome Artrell Kirkwood in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jerome Artrell Kirkwood.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Att Rosenthal- Client will waive prelim, wants to be heard on bail
Court accepts waiver, binds him over for arraignment, Citations to continue trailing
Att Rosenthal requests $1000 cash bail, Gives ties to area
State- Most history for Illinois. Doesn't get FTA's from there. Has pending case in Duluth. Charges also in IA and MS. Opposes reduction
Court- reviews CM case. He was appearing on that case. Lowers bond to $1000 cash, conditions to continue.
Att Rosenthal- On the CM case he has Att Van Ert, will be taking over that file, Att Van Ert isn't certified to do felony cases.
Arraignment scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Notice of intent to revoke operator's license

records.addlTxt: Do not use or possess any firearms. No use or possession of alcohol.

3:11 PM Defendant Jerome Artrell Kirkwood appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Van Ert appeared by video in court for defendant Jerome Kirkwood. Address was verified. Attorney Van Ert received complaint waives reading and requests preliminary hearing on felony count. State requests $5,000 cash bail with conditions of no use or possession of alcohol. Do not use or possess any firearms. Defendant has an open Douglas County case. Defendant's criminal history is mainly out of IL which fta's are not tracked along with criminal history out of Mississippi. No local ties. Attorney Van Ert asks for a lower cash bond. Court questions local ties of defendant. Defendant has a brother that lives in Douglas County. Court orders $2,000 cash bail with conditions of do not use or possess any firearms and no use or possession of alcohol.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
